result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Sharon J Weimer in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Sharon J Weimer.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel J. Gabler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance and request adjournment for discovery and pretrial.
Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with Fleet Farm stores or Piggly Wiggly stores in Washington County.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Sharon J Weimer in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Court appoints Atty Nolan Jensen.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11-15-2022.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $1,500.00 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.
